titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7201) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide incentives for energy production and conservation, and for other purposes and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7202) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend certain expiring provisions, to provide individual income tax relief, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 110-902, by Mr. Arcuri.

It shall be in order to consider in the House the bills H.R. 7201 and H.R. 7202. All points of order against consideration of the bills are waived except those arising under clause 10 of rule XXI. The bills shall be considered as read. All points of order against the bills are waived. The previous question shall be considered as ordered on the bills to final passage without intervening motion except: (1) one hour of debate equally divided and controlled by the chairman and ranking minority member of the Committee on Ways and Means; and (2) one motion to recommit, on

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 285.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 1516.
WITHDRAWAL OF RESOLUTION - Pursuant to the rule, Mr. Arcuri withdrew the resolution from consideration.
Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 1533, H. Res. 1516 is laid on the table.

bill.summary: 9/28/2008--Introduced. Sets forth the rule for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7201) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide incentives for energy production and conservation, and for other purposes and providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 7202) to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend certain expiring provisions, to provide individual income tax relief.
